required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Determining the Presence of RAP in Orthognathic Patients and Its Effect on Root Resorption by Biomarkers
clinical_study.official_title: Use of Biomarkers in Early Surgery Patients to Determine Effectiveness of Regional Acceleratory Phenomenon and Its Effect on Root Resorption

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective clinical trial to what extent inflammatory biomarkers are affected by the medication after orthognathic surgery in early surgical cases and whether these biomarkers affects the amount of maxillary or mandibular incisor root resorption.

detailed_description.textblock: To conduct a prospective clinical trial to what extent inflammatory biomarkers such as OPG, RANKL, IL-1, IL-6, and CRP are affected by the medication after orthognathic surgery in early surgical cases and whether these biomarkers affects the amount of maxillary or mandibular incisor root resorption.

primary_outcome.measure: Assessing Change Between Three Time Points of Biomarkers to Determine Effectiveness of Regional Acceleratory Phenomenon
primary_outcome.time_frame: To see the change at biomarker levels GCF samples were collected at the time points designated as T0, T1, and T2 which correspond to the day of the surgery before anesthesia, 1 week after the surgery, and 4 weeks after the surgery

primary_outcome.measure: Assessing Change Between Two Time Points to Determine Root Resorption
primary_outcome.time_frame: To see the change of root length all radiographs were taken digitally at t0 (at the beginning of orthodontic preparation), t1 (just before the orthognathic surgery), and t2 ( an average of 1,5 years postop) with an X-ray unit

arm_group.description: Otherwise healthy patients with Skeletal Class III problem

intervention.description: The duration for presurgical orthodontic treatment was; 7,7 ± 1,7 months.

study_pop.textblock: The study was started by collecting GCF before surgery from 25 patients. Patients who developed exclusion criteria while the study was in progress were excluded from the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
1. Have skeletal Cl III malocclusion
2. Wisdom teeth are absent or extracted at least 6 months before the surgery
3. Need of orthognathic surgery through Le Fort I osteotomy of the maxilla and bilateral sagittal split osteotomies (BSSO) of the mandible.
4. Undergo fixed orthodontic treatment before and after the orthognathic surgery
5. Have available orthopantomograms with adequate quality
6. Have healthy periodontal tissue without inflammation or bleeding before and after the surgery.
7. Maintain the same medication protocol during and after the surgery.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. ongoing use of regular medication
2. smoking
3. known penicillin allergy,
4. any immune disorder,
5. musculoskeletal diseases,
6. syndromes,
7. cleft lip-palate,
8. systemic diseases affecting root resorption,
9. periodontal and gingival disorders,
10. missing teeth among upper or lower incisors,
11. poor oral hygiene.
